channel.title: Interleaved RSS Feed
channel.description: This is an interleaved feed of the most recent entries from each RSS source, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: Developers Are Ditching This State as Regulations Rise
item.description: Why are developers ditching California NOW? Is commercial real estate still struggling, and what’s up with all those empty office buildings all over town? Does it seem like everyone is […]

item.title: UK launches formal probe into Amazon’s ties with AI startup Anthropic
item.description: The U.K.’s antitrust regulator has confirmed that it’s carrying out a formal antitrust investigation into Amazon’s ties with Anthropic, after Amazon recently completed a $4 billion investment into the AI startup. The news comes a week after the Competition and Markets Authority (CMA) revealed it was launching an invitation to comment into Google’s own ties with […] © 2024 TechCrunch. All rights reserved. For personal use only.

item.title: Tim Walz on Criminal Justice: 5 Things to Know
item.description: Where Minnesota Gov. Tim Walz, Vice President Kamala Harris’ running mate, stands on policing, guns, prison reform and other issues.

item.title: Half of America’s Homes Are Equity-Rich—And These States Have the Most
item.description: According to Q2 data, about half of U.S. households are "equity-rich," with the biggest gains in the South and Midwest.

item.title: AI business agent startup Bardeen pulls in strategic investment from Dropbox and Hubspot
item.description: Bardeen has raised $3M to build its platform that uses a natural language interface to automate repetitive knowledge work. © 2024 TechCrunch. All rights reserved. For personal use only.

item.title: They Exposed Police Misconduct. Now They’re Paying a Steep Price.
item.description: Whistleblower laws have advanced in public and private sectors, but protections for police who report illegal or unethical behavior lag far behind.

item.title: Unique Rentals: What You Need to Know About Tree Houses, Tiny Homes, and Houseboats
item.description: How much of a difference can offering unique short-term rentals make to your portfolio?

item.title: Bilingual dictation assistant Silvia understands ‘Spanglish’ and other language mixtures
item.description: Natural language AI assistants tend to be excellent English speakers, and passable in other tongues — but if you are one of the millions who fluidly switch between two languages on the fly, they’re stumped. A new AI helper called Silvia, however, understands “Spanglish” just fine, with more language combos to come. The app — […] © 2024 TechCrunch. All rights reserved. For personal use only.

item.title: Drawing Attention
item.description: News Inside Issue 17 features the opinions of justice-affected people on Trump’s felonies, and a nonfiction comic about death penalty mitigation.

item.title: How Building Codes Have Helped Create Gigantic Supply Gaps.
item.description: Strict building codes have made it challenging to build quickly and efficiently throughout the country. We list six ways they've impacted the housing crisis.

item.title: Indian conglomerate Reliance slashed over 42,000 jobs last financial year
item.description: Reliance, India's largest conglomerate, reduced its workforce by 11%, or more than 42,000 people, in the financial year ended March 2024. © 2024 TechCrunch. All rights reserved. For personal use only.

item.title: These Private Centers Lack Oversight. Cuyahoga County Judges Send Kids Anyway.
item.description: Courts are increasingly sending children to private youth care centers, spending millions while detention center overcrowding persists.

item.title: A New Chapter at BiggerPockets: Welcoming TCG, Celebrating 3 Million Members, and Introducing New Tools Designed to Uplevel Your Investments
item.description: An important announcement from BiggerPockets CEO & President Scott Trench.

item.title: Anduril raises $1.5B at a $14B valuation
item.description: The Palmer Luckey-founded defense startup wants to become a serious rival to longstanding kingpins, and has been clocking some big wins. © 2024 TechCrunch. All rights reserved. For personal use only.

item.title: Facing Rollbacks, Criminal Justice Reformers Argue Policies Make People Safer
item.description: Advocates are refining their rebuttal to “tough on crime” messaging: Don’t focus on punishment, but on reforms that improve public safety.
